abstract_summ: After multivariate logistic regression analyses, the lower the MRC sum-score the greater the risk of reintubation; severe limb weakness was independently associated with extubation failure, even after adjustment on cough strength and severity at admission.This study aimed at assessing the role of ICU-acquired weakness on extubation failure and the relation between limb weakness and cough strength.ICU-acquired weakness was clinically diagnosed as limb weakness defined as Medical Research Council (MRC) score < 48 points and severe weakness as MRC sum-score < 36.CONCLUSION ICU-acquired weakness was diagnosed in 38% in this population of patients at high risk at the time of extubation and was independently associated with extubation failure in the ICU.BACKGROUND Whereas ICU-acquired weakness may delay extubation in mechanically ventilated patients, its influence on extubation failure is poorly known.
title_summ: Management of Respiratory Distress Syndrome in Preterm Infants In Wales: A Full Audit Cycle of a Quality Improvement ProjectAn intervention to decrease time to parents’ first hold of infants in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit requiring respiratory supportRole of ICU-acquired weakness on extubation outcome among patients at high risk of reintubation.
title_abstract_phrases: After multivariate logistic regression analyses, the lower the MRC sum-score the greater the risk of reintubation; severe limb weakness was independently associated with extubation failure, even after adjustment on cough strength and severity at admission.This study aimed at assessing the role of ICU-acquired weakness on extubation failure and the relation between limb weakness and cough strength.CONCLUSION ICU-acquired weakness was diagnosed in 38% in this population of patients at high risk at the time of extubation and was independently associated with extubation failure in the ICU.ICU-acquired weakness was clinically diagnosed as limb weakness defined as Medical Research Council (MRC) score < 48 points and severe weakness as MRC sum-score < 36.BACKGROUND Whereas ICU-acquired weakness may delay extubation in mechanically ventilated patients, its influence on extubation failure is poorly known.
